member.name: T:IronPdf.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: IronPDF is a.NET library allowing the generation and manipulation of PDF files in C# and other .Net projects.

member.name: T:IronPdf.Installation
member.summary: Global installation and setup preferences for all instances of IronPDF

member.name: F:IronPdf.Installation.TempFolderPath
member.summary: The temporary folder path which temporary files and rendering engine DLLs will be deployed to where necessary. The default location is the system temp folder which is appropriate for most use cases.

member.name: T:IronPdf.Util
member.summary: Useful methods for working with HTML and PDF files.

member.name: M:IronPdf.Util.ImageToDataUri(System.Drawing.Image,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Turns a System.Drawing.Image or System.Drawing.Bitmapinto a DataUri which can used to embed the Image directly into an HTML document.
Read standard https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme
member.param: A non-null System.Drawing.Image or System.Drawing.Bitmap
Optional flag to flatten the image to raw pixels to increase compatibility with HTML (may affect PDF file size and rendering time)
member.returns: A data URL which can be used as the src attribute of an HTML

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf
member.summary: IronPdf.HtmlToPdf allows any web page or Html 'snippet' to be turned into a PDF document.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.StaticRenderUrlAsPdf(System.Uri,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions,IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials)
member.summary: Static version of the function. Renders all Html and assets at a given Url into a PDF file.
member.param: An absolute Uri. Points to the Html document to be rendered as a PDF.
Instance of . Optional print options and settings.
Instance of . Optional login credentials for Windows, Linux and Html Form login environments.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.StaticRenderUrlAsPdf(System.String,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions,IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials)
member.summary: Static version of the function. Renders all Html and assets at a given Url into a PDF file.
member.param: An absolute Url or file path. Points to the Html document to be rendered as a PDF.
Instance of . Optional print options and settings.
Instance of . Optional login credentials for Windows, Linux and Html Form login environments.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.StaticRenderHTMLFileAsPdf(System.String,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions)
member.summary: Renders an HTML file as PDF binary data.
member.param: Path to an Html file.
Instance of . Optional print options and settings.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.StaticRenderHtmlAsPdf(System.String,System.String,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Static version of the function. Renders any Html strings into a PDF document.
member.param: Html to be turned into a PDF.
Setting the BaseUrlOrPath property gives the Html a relative for content links such as hyper-links, images, CSS and JavaScript files.
Instance of . Optional print options and settings.
Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port/

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.StaticRenderHtmlAsPdf(System.String,System.Uri,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Static version of the function. Renders any Html strings into a PDF document.
member.param: Html to be turned into a PDF.
Setting the BaseURL property gives the Html a relative for content links such as hyper-links, images, CSS and JavaScript files.
Instance of . Optional print options and settings.
Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port/

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.RenderUrlAsPdf(System.Uri)
member.summary: Renders the URL as PDF binary data.
member.param: An absolute Uri. Points to the Html document to be rendered as a PDF.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.RenderUrlAsPdf(System.String)
member.summary: Renders the URL as PDF binary data.
member.param: A url or file path.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.RenderHTMLFileAsPdf(System.String)
member.summary: Renders an HTML file as PDF binary data.
member.param: Path to an Html file.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.RenderHtmlAsPdf(System.String,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a PDF file from an Html string, and returns it as an IronPdf.PdfDocument
member.param: The Html to be rendered as a PDF.
Setting the BaseURL property gives the relative context for hyper-links, images, CSS and JavaScript files.
Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.RenderHtmlAsPdf(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a PDF file from an Html string, and returns it as an IronPdf.PdfDocument
member.param: The Html to be rendered as a PDF.
Setting the BaseUrlOrPath property gives the relative context for hyper-links, images, CSS and JavaScript files.
Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.PrintOptions
member.summary: An instance of the class. Sets PDF output options such as Paper-Size, DPI, Headers and Footers.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.LoginCredentials
member.summary: An instance of the class. Allows developers to specify login credentials using Windows, Linux or Html Forms based authentication. This allows PDFs to be printed, even if they reside on private Intranets, Extranets or within 'login' areas of websites.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.#ctor
member.summary: The IronPdf.HtmlToPdf allows developers to create PDF files from any web page or Html Snippet

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlToPdf.#ctor(IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions)
member.param: Sets PDF output options such as paper-size, DPI, headers and footers using an instance of the IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions Class.

member.name: T:IronPdf.AspxToPdf
member.summary: Renders any .Net Web Page (ASPX) into a PDF Document. Simply add it to the Page_Load event.

member.name: T:IronPdf.AspxToPdf.FileBehavior
member.summary: Determines the web browser behavior towards a PDF document.

member.name: F:IronPdf.AspxToPdf.FileBehavior.Attachment
member.summary: Instructs the user's web-browser to download the PDF as a file.

member.name: F:IronPdf.AspxToPdf.FileBehavior.InBrowser
member.summary: Instructs the user's web-browser to render the PDF wherever possible.

member.name: M:IronPdf.AspxToPdf.RenderThisPageAsPdf(IronPdf.AspxToPdf.FileBehavior,System.String,IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions)
member.param: Specifies if the PDF file should be downloaded as an attachment, or displayed directly in the browser of users.
The file-name of the PDF. If no name is set, a suitable name will be automatically assigned chosen based on the Html title, PrintOptions or name of the ASPX page.
Sets PDF output options such as PDF Title, paper-size, DPI, headers and footers.

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter
M:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.Height
member.summary: Height of the Html Header / Footer in millimeters. This value must be set sufficiently high to display the full html header / footer content.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.HtmlFragment
member.summary: The Html which will be use to render the Header / Footer. Should be an HTML snippet rather than a complete document. May contain styles & images. Merge meta-data into the HtmlFragment by putting any of these placeholder strings into the text: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}. An alternative mail-merge style using the pattern also workd

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter.BaseUrl
member.summary: The Base URL all URLS in the HtmlFragment will be relative to. This includes src attributives on images, scripts, style-sheets and also hrefs on hyper-links.

member.name: T:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter
member.summary: Defines PDF Header and Footer display options.

member.name: M:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.Clone
member.summary: Clones this instance.

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.LeftText
member.summary:
Sets the left hand side header text for the PDF document.
Merge meta-data into your header using any of these placeholder strings: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.CenterText
member.summary:
Sets the centered header text for the PDF document.
Merge meta-data into your header using any of these placeholder strings: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.RightText
member.summary:
Sets the right hand side header text for the PDF document.
Merge meta-data into your header using any of these placeholder strings: {page} {total-pages} {url} {date} {time} {html-title} {pdf-title}

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.FontFamily
member.summary: Font used to render the PDF header.

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.FontSize
member.summary: Font size in px.

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.DrawDividerLine
member.summary: Adds a horizontal line divider between the header / footer and the page content on every page of the PDF document.

member.name: F:IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter.Spacing
member.summary: Space between the header and page content in millimeters.

member.name: T:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials
member.summary: Provides credentials for IronPdf to log-in to an intranet, extranet or website, impersonating a user. This allows a unique ability to render web-pages as PDFs even on secure intranets, extranets and websites.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.NetworkUsername
member.summary: Optional: User-name credential for Windows / Linux network security authentication.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.NetworkPassword
member.summary: Optional: Password credential for Windows / Linux network security authentication.

member.name: P:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.UserAgent
member.summary: The Http User-Agent header which will be used to fetch any remote HTML.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.LoginFormUrl
member.summary: Optional: Gives the URL to post website login-form authentication. Should be the absolute Url which the form's action attribute specifies.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.LoginFormPostVariables
member.summary: Optional: Specifies a collection of HTTP form variables to post/submit to .

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostVariables
member.summary:
Optional: Specifies a collection of HTTP 'POST' variables to submit on every PDF rendering request.
Note: The 'key' is the name of the post field, The 'value' is its value. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.CustomPostFiles
member.summary:
Optional, Advanced Usage: Specifies a collection files to summited on every PDF rendering request. Allows images and documents to be submitted to forms such that the output will be rendered as an PDF.
Note: The Key is the name of the post field, The value is the full file path.. UrlEncoding is not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.CustomCookies
member.summary: A Dictionary which allows custom cookies to be posted with every login request, and HTTP request made by RenderUriToHml methods.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.EnableCookies
member.summary: Enables cookies to be stored and sent when using RenderUriToHml methods.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.Proxy
member.summary: e Specifies an Http proxy server. Use the pattern: http(s)://user-name:password@host:port/

member.name: F:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.CustomHttpHeaders
member.summary: A dictionary of custom HTTP headers to be sent with every HTTP Request

member.name: M:IronPdf.HttpLoginCredentials.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor cleans up all temporary cookies files for the HttpLoginCredentials instance.

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlStamp
member.summary: Class HtmlStamp. Used With the methods to edit PDF documents by 'stamping' additional content into the foreground or background.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTML fragment which will be stamped onto your PDF.

member.name: M:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTML fragment which will be stamped onto your PDF.
The width of the stamp in mm.
The height of the stamp in mm.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Width
member.summary: The width of the stamp in mm. Stamps can not automatically detect their own size based on their content.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Height
member.summary: The height of the stamp in mm. Stamps can not automatically detect their own size based on their content.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Html
member.summary: The HTML fragment which will be stamped onto your PDF. All external references to javascript, CSS and image files will be relative to .

members.member: The position of the stamp from the Top edge of the PDF document in mm. If Top or Bottom is not set, the stamp will be vertically centered in the document. f
The position of the stamp from the Bottom edge of the PDF document in mm. If Top or Bottom is not set, the stamp will be vertically centered in the document. f

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Left
member.summary: The position of the stamp from the Left of the PDF document in mm. If Left or Right is not set, the stamp will be horizontally centered in the document.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Right
member.summary: The position of the stamp from the Right of the PDF document in mm. If Left or Right is not set, the stamp will be horizontally centered in the document.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Opactity
member.summary: Allows the stamp to be transparent. 0 is invisible, 100 if fully opaque.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Rotation
member.summary: Rotates the stamp clockwise from 0 to 360 degrees as specified.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.Hyperlink
member.summary: Makes the entire stamp link to a web hyperlink. Note that HTML links created by <a href=''> tags are not reserved by stamping.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.AutoCenterStampContentOnStampCanvas
member.summary: The automatic centers stamp content within stamp canvas as defined by Width and Height.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.HtmlBaseUrl
member.summary:
The HTML base URL for which references to external CSS, Javascript and Image files will be relative.
A trick to make references relative to a your project file is HtmlBaseUrl = new Uri(System.Reflection.Assembly.GetEntryAssembly().Location).AbsoluteUri

member.name: T:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.StampLayer
member.summary: Defines if a stamp should be placed behind or on-top of existing PDF contents.

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.StampLayer.BehindExistingPDFContent
member.summary: Stamp in the background

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.StampLayer.OnTopOfExistingPDFContent
member.summary: Stamp in the foreground

member.name: F:IronPdf.HtmlStamp.ZIndex
member.summary: Defines if this stamp should be placed behind or on-top of existing PDF contents.

member.name: T:IronPdf.PdfDocument
member.summary: A PDF Document

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.AddHeaders(IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Renders page headers to an existing PDF File
member.param: An new instance of IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter that defines the header content and layout.
if set to true, the first (cover) page is not counted or stamped with a header.
Optional. The PageIndexes (zero-based page numbers) to which the header will be added.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.AddFooters(IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Renders page footers to an existing PDF File
member.param: An new instance of IronPdf.SimpleHeaderFooter that defines the footer content and layout.
if set to true, the first (cover) page is not counted or stamped with a footer.
Optional. The PageIndexes (zero-based page numbers) to which the footer will be added.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.AddHTMLHeaders(IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Renders HTML page headers to an existing PDF File
member.param: An new instance of IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter that defines the header content and layout.
if set to true, the first (cover) page is not counted or stamped with a header.
Optional. The PageIndexes (zero-based page numbers) to which the header will be added.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.AddHTMLFooters(IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: RendersHTML page footers to an existing PDF File
member.param: An new instance of IronPdf.HtmlHeaderFooter that defines the footer content and layout.
if set to true, the first (cover) page is not counted or stamped with a footer.
Optional. The PageIndexes (zero-based page numbers) to which the footer will be added.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfDocument.Password
member.summary: Sets a Password used to protect and encrypt the PDF File. Setting a password will cause IronPDF to automatically protect the PDF file content using strong 128 bit encryption. Setting the password to null will remove any existing password.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.FromFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing PDF document for editing.
member.param: The PDF file path.
Optional password if the PDF document is protected / encrypted.
member.exception: Exception thrown if can not be opened.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens an existing PDF document for editing.
member.param: The PDF file path.
Optional password if the PDF document is protected / encrypted.
member.exception: Exception thrown if can not be opened.

member.summary: Opens an existing PDF document for editing.
member.param: The PDF file data as a Stream.

member.exception: Exception thrown if can not be opened.

member.exception: Exception thrown if can not be opened.

member.summary: Attempt to save the PdfDocument to a file.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ExtractAllBitmaps
member.summary: Finds all embedded Images from within the PDF and returns then as System.Drawing.Bitmap objects

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ExtractBitmapsFromPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds all embedded Images from within one page of the PDF and returns them as System.Drawing.Bitmap objects

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.Merge(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{IronPdf.PdfDocument})
member.summary: Static method that joins (concatenates) multiple PDF documents together into one compiled PDF document.
member.param: A IEnumerable of PdfDocument. To merge existing PDF files you may use the PdfDocument.FromFile static method in conjunction with Merge.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ExtractAllText
member.summary:
Extracts the written text content from the PDF and returns it as a string. (PDF OCR). Pages will be separated by 4 consecutive newline characters ("



")
member.returns: All text in the PDF as a string.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ExtractTextFromPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts the text content from one page of the PDF and returns it as a string. (PDF OCR)
member.param: Index of the page. Note: Page 1 has index 0...

member.summary:
Extracts the written text content from a range of pages within the PDF and returns it as a string. (PDF OCR). Pages will be separated by 4 consecutive newline characters ("



")
member.param: The start page index. Note: Page 1 has index 0
The end page index. Note: The last page has index PageCount -1

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.ExtractTextFromPages(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})

")

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.WatermarkPage(System.String,System.Int32,IronPdf.PdfDocument.WaterMarkLocation,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Watermarks a single page of this PDF with HTML content.
Watermarks are restricted to basic positioning and a 100mm by 100mm maximum size. For more advanced options see
member.param: The HTML fragment
The page index (zero-based page number) of this PDF to watermark.
The location of the watermark.
The opacity of the watermark from 0-100%. 100 is opaque, 0 is invisible.
The rotation of the watermark content in clockwise degrees.
An optional hyperlink which the watermark will link to.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.WatermarkAllPages(System.String,IronPdf.PdfDocument.WaterMarkLocation,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Watermarks all pages of this PDF with HTML content.
Watermarks are restricted to basic positioning and a 100mm by 100mm maximum size. For more advanced options see
member.param: The HTML fragment
The location of the watermark.
The opacity of the watermark from 0-100%. 100 is opaque, 0 is invisible.
The rotation of the watermark content in clockwise degrees.
An optional hyperlink which the watermark will link to.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfDocument.WatermarkPages(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},IronPdf.PdfDocument.WaterMarkLocation,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Watermarks all pages of this PDF with HTML content.
Watermarks are restricted to basic positioning and a 100mm by 100mm maximum size. For more advanced options see
member.param: The HTML fragment
A list of page index (zero-based page number) of this PDF to watermark.
The location of the watermark.
The opacity of the watermark from 0-100%. 100 is opaque, 0 is invisible.
The rotation of the watermark content in clockwise degrees.
An optional hyperlink which the watermark will link to.

member.name: T:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions
member.summary: PDF output options for IronPdf. Specifies options such as Paper-Size, DPI, Headers and Footers.

member.name: T:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PdfPaperSize
member.summary: Defines the target paper size the PDF will use of pagination. Relates to real-world paper-sizes.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.Header
member.summary: Sets the footer content for every PDF page as Html or String. Supports 'mail-merge'.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.Footer
member.summary: Sets the header content for every PDF page as Html or String. Supports 'mail-merge'.

member.name: T:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PdfPaperOrientation
member.summary: Paper Orientation

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.InputEncoding
member.summary: The input character encoding as a string;

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.SetCustomPaperSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the size of the custom paper. Depreciated.
member.param: The width.
The height.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.SetCustomPaperSizeinMilimeters(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set an output paper size for PDF pages. Dimensions are in millimeters.
member.param: Custom paper width in millimeters.
>Custom paper height in millimeters.

member.name: M:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.SetCustomPaperSizeInInches(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set an output paper size for PDF pages. Dimensions are in Inches.
member.param: Custom paper width in Inches.
>Custom paper height in Inches.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.Zoom
member.summary: The zoom level in %. Enlarges the rendering size of Html documents.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.DPI
member.summary: Printing output DPI. 300 is standard for most print jobs. Higher resolutions produce clearer images and text, but also larger PDF files.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.GrayScale
member.summary: Outputs a black-and-white PDF

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.CustomCssUrl
member.summary: Allows a custom CSS style-sheet to be applied to Html before rendering. May be a local file path, or remote url.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Quality of any image that must be re-sampled. 0-100

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.MarginLeft
member.summary: Paper margin in millimeters. Set to zero for border-less and commercial printing applications.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.MarginBottom
member.summary: Paper margin in millimeters. Set to zero for border-less and commercial printing applications.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.MarginTop
member.summary: Paper margin in millimeters. Set to zero for border-less and commercial printing applications.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.MarginRight
member.summary: Paper margin in millimeters. Set to zero for border-less and commercial printing applications.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PaperSize
member.summary:
Set an output paper size for PDF pages. System.Drawing.Printing.PaperKind.
Use SetCustomPaperSize(int width, int height) for custom sizes.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PaperOrientation
member.summary: The PDF paper orientation.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PrintHtmlBackgrounds
member.summary: Prints background-colors and images from Html

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.CssMediaType
member.summary:
Enables Media="screen" CSS Styles and StyleSheets
Note: By setting AllowScreenCss=false, IronPdf prints using CSS for media="print" only.

member.name: T:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.PdfCssMediaType
member.summary: Defines which style-sheet should be rendered. 'Print' or 'Screen'. This matches the CSS3 Media Queries standard.

members.member: Renders as expected for a web browser.
Ignores 'Print' styles and includes additional 'Screen' styles where available.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.EnableJavaScript
member.summary:
Enables JavaScript and Json to be executed before the page is rendered. Ideal for printing from Ajax / Angular Applications.
Also see RenderDelay -

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.CreatePdfFormsFromHtml
member.summary: Turns all Html forms elements into editable PDF forms.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.Title
member.summary: PDF Document Name and Title meta-data. Not required.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.FitToPaperWidth
member.summary: Where possible, fits the PDF content to 1 page width.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.RenderDelay
member.summary: Milliseconds to wait after Html is rendered before printing. This can use useful when considering the rendering of JavaScript, Ajax or animations.

member.name: F:IronPdf.PdfPrintOptions.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: First page number to be used in PDF headers and footers.

member.name: T:IronPdf.License
member.summary: Allows IronPdf license keys to be applied globally across an application.

member.name: F:IronPdf.License.LicenseKey
member.summary: Removes watermarks. Get Licensed at http://ironpdf.com/license A License key can also be added to Web.Config or App.Config as IronPdf.LicenseKey

member.name: M:IronPdf.License.IsValidLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a license key is valid.
member.param: IronPDf license key as a string
